bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Writing shang shi 傷螫 ; shi ren 螫人 , to sting a person; shinie 螫嚙 , [injury from] sting and bite; dingshi 叮螫， [injury from a] sting. Pathological Condition of a shang sun 傷損 , injury, that is a zhong du 中毒 , poisoning, caused by poisonous sting or teeth of a venomous bug/worm or snake. Pu ji fang 普濟方 307: 治蠍 螫傷，詩曰：曾聞蠍螫徹心田，休候雞兒叫曉天。耳塞調來疼處抹，除 毒減痛却依元 , “To cure an injury from a scorpion sting , a poem says: I have heard, an injury from a scorpion sting goes right into the heart. But it is not necessary to wait for the rooster to crow at dawn. Just prepare some earwax and smear it on where the pain is located. This will remove the poison, diminish the pain, and restore [the patient’s] original condition”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 lists the following animals as potential causers of an injury from a sting: she hui 蛇虺 , venomous viper; du she 毒蛇 , poisonous snake; du feng 毒蜂 , poisonous wasp; she chong 蛇 蟲 , snakes and bugs/worms; zhu she 諸蛇 , all types of snakes; she xie 蛇蠍 , snakesand scorpions; fu she 蝮蛇 , pallas pit viper; xie chai 蠍蠆 , scorpion; feng xie 蜂蠍 , wasps/bees and scorpions; feng chai 蜂蠆 , scorpion.
